Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style or Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline with added red centre; exterior, from top: at rim, trace of two lines; band of solid tongues with outline; band of dash and billet pattern; below, part of large maeander square to the left of a vertical dividing band consisting of dotted blanks between pairs of lines.
Curator's comments: The sherd ought to belong to the end of the period of the Wild Goat Style since, although the metopal pattern decoration on the exterior surface is typical of the Wild Goat Style, the lotus decoration on the interior, which is absent during this period, is typical in the later reserved Mature Animal Style. Furthermore, the heavy chalice does not normally appear in the Wild Goat Style, and the thickness and diameter of this sherd suggest that it comes from a vessel much larger than a chalice. Perhaps this sherd marks the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1528) (phase 2)
